column2: latin_songs %>% filter(track_artist %in% top_artist_list, track_popularity > 0, track_album_release_date > '2007-01-01') %>% select(track_artist, track_popularity, track_album_release_date) %>% group_by(track_artist, track_album_release_date) %>% summarize(track_popularity=mean(track_popularity)) %>% ggplot(aes(x=track_album_release_date, y=track_popularity, color=track_artist))  + geom_line() + labs(x = 'Track Album Release Date', y='Track Popularity Score', title='Track Popularity Score for 6 Most Popular Artists', subtitle = 'Some artist such as Daddy Yankee and Shakira have had tracks with fairly high popularity scores. \nOn the other hand, the other artists have had tracks with high track popularity scores, as well as \nlow scores.', color='Track Artists')
`summarise()` has grouped output by 'track_artist'. You can override using the `.groups` argument.
